page.title: 04Clubs
page.content: A public hall was erected in 1932 by the efforts of the parishioners. This hall is used by both the old and young in the community, for their many and varied activities. The Rural holds its monthly meeting on the second Tuesday of each month, and on the first Tuesday the Guild holds its meetings from October to Easter. A badminton club was reformed two seasons ago and is now thriving with thirty members. They have one club night a week, and one match night as they are members of a league. On a Tuesday afternoon, the Mothers and Toddlers group meet in the hall. The minister holds a youth club for children between 12-18 years on alternate Friday nights. An indoor bowling club also uses the hall.
